content.description:
Qigong (pronounced chee-gong) begins with a low start on the right hand side. Pull through some tough crimps moving up and left, then jump throw to a good left hand crimp. Snatch the arête, and top it out. A right kneepad is helpful for certain body types for the start.

Note,

the block to the right is off

!

If your foot or any part of your body touches it in any way, you didn't do Qigong. There is a variant start that utilizes the right block called

The Gong Show

which is easier.
content.protection: Large pads. This is not a highball, but the landing area is not great. Use at least two big fatties, preferably four.

content.description:
This is the poor man's

Qigong

as you start with a right foot, heel-toe scum, foot lock or kneebar that uses the right block. You can only claim a

Qigong

send if you don't touch the right block in any way.

youtube.com/watch?v=_WlynYd…

.
content.protection: Large pads. This is not a highball, but the landing area is not great. Use at least two big fatties, preferably four.
